intro: Linaria pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and dry conditions. Linaria pamirica has narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous flowers in clusters, making it a distinctive species in its habitat. It is often found in the Pamir Mountains and surrounding areas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
